awd_titl_txt: Overcoming Barriers in Lifeline Seismic Risk Reduction
awd_abstract_narration: 9502771  Taylor  Through  examining and evaluating how successful lifeline  seismic risk  reduction  programs  evolve,  this    project  takes  a   new  direction  in  seismic policy analysis.  Previous  investigations have given  more  attention  to  barriers  to  seismic    policy  implementation.  Case  studies of nine  successful  seismic  risk reduction  programs will be conducted.  Data  will  be  collected through    detailed   interviews   with  knowledgeable   parties  representing   pertinent  internal  and  external  organizations.  These  examinations  will clarify internal and  external  factors related to program success.  A project advisory  panel will review interim  procedures  and  results.  Project  findings  will   be  published  in  a  monograph aimed at two  audiences:  (1)  policy  makers   who  need  to  understand  seismic  risk  and  decision techniques used in these programs, and (2)  engineers who wish  to understand the policy making process.  ***
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
